New Records: Emilio Nsue scored his second hat-trick in international football
Key Match Events: Emilio Nsue's second goal was scored from the back post courtesy of Basilio Ndong's delivery
Josete Miranda volleyed his side back ahead in the second half
Emilio Nsue brought up his hat-trick via a clinical one-on-one strike past Ouparine Djoco
Zé Turbo fired in a late consolation for Guinea-Bissau deep in second-half stoppage-time
Pre-Game Insights: Before the tournament, this was widely seen as a straight duel to avoid last place
Post-Match Reflections: Unbelievably, against all pre-tournament expectations, this comprehensive victory for Equatorial Guinea provisionally lifts them above Ivory Coast to the top of Group A
Meanwhile, Guinea-Bissau now have it all to do if they want to qualify for the knockout stages
Miscellaneous Highlights: The comeback then seemed to be truly on when referee Samuel Uwikunda pointed to the spot, for what appeared like a clumsy challenge from Saúl Coco on Franculino Djú, however VAR would save Equatorial Guinea on this occasion
The Djurtus unsurprisingly began the stronger, yet it was at the opposite end of the field where the deadlock would be broken in the 21st minute

The Elefantes’ early second-half charge towards victory was not finished there, as Nsue shortly slotted home his second goal from the back post courtesy of Basilio Ndong’s delivery into the danger zone
